label: 名主
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Level of peasantry above the common status of cultivator. Generally head of a patriarchally organized group of cultivators, it was in his name that myōden were registered. Myōshu were the members of the village community responsible for the management of myōden and the rendering of taxes to the higher shiki holders.　[名田、職]
